subject: Re: [junit] Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily	life?
msgSnippet: ... This is perhaps great advice for a very experienced developer, someone who has the prescience to know when they are about to write perfect code. Otherwise,
messageBody:
Quoting CÃ©dric Beust ? <cbeust@...>:
> Just like everything else, use TDD sparingly.

This is perhaps great advice for a very experienced developer, someone
who has the prescience to know when they are about to write perfect
code.

Otherwise, for someone just starting out and learning TDD, I'd suggest
trying to first learn how to grow solutions incrementally before
deciding it's not their style.

Jeff L.
http://langrsoft.com/agileJava
